title: How to Delete or Edit a Radio Button in Microsoft Excel

steps.title: Open Excel.
steps.content: Open Excel. It's in your Start menu or Applications folder in Finder. The Developer tab will remain visible until you turn it off or reinstall Microsoft Office.

steps.title: Click File (Windows) or Excel (Mac).
steps.content: Click File (Windows) or Excel (Mac). You'll see the "File" tab in the editing ribbon above your workspace for Windows and the "Excel" tab in the menu at the top of your screen for a Mac.

steps.title: Hover over Options/Preferences and select Customize Ribbon/Ribbon & Toolbar.
steps.content: Hover over Options/Preferences and select Customize Ribbon/Ribbon & Toolbar . A new window will open with options for the editing ribbon. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click to select the box next to "Developer.
steps.content: Click to select the box next to "Developer. " It's under "Main Tabs." [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Save and close the window (if necessary).
steps.content: Click Save and close the window (if necessary). If the window doesn't close by itself, you need to click the x manually.

steps.title: Open your project in Excel.
steps.content: Open your project in Excel. You can open your project within Excel by going to File > Open or you can right-click the Excel file and select Open with > Excel .

steps.title: Turn on Design Mode.
steps.content: Turn on Design Mode. Go to the Developer tab and click Design Mode in the "Controls" group. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Select the button/controls you want to delete.
steps.content: Select the button/controls you want to delete. Click to select them, and they will highlight to indicate that you have them selected. You can also select all the buttons in your Excel project by pressing CTRL/Cmd + A .

steps.title: Press ← Backspace (Windows) or Delete (Mac).
steps.content: Press ← Backspace (Windows) or Delete (Mac). The selected buttons will disappear from your worksheet. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source
